channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Maddie Durdant-Hollamby: Tributes to Kettering murder victim
item.description: Maddie Durdant-Hollamby, 22, was discovered dead at a house where the body of a man was also found.

item.title: Man dies after assault on Birmingham night out
item.description: The 50-year-old was taken to hospital on Sunday, where he later died, police say.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing sorry for foul-mouthed message to aide
item.description: Pen Farthing says he was "at the lowest point" as he tried to get staff and animals out of Afghanistan.

item.title: Hatchling: Giant dragon puppet flies off Plymouth coast
item.description: The Hatchling spent the weekend travelling the streets of Plymouth before flying away.

item.title: Cambridgeshire python: Snake's tree rescue 'like a scene from Jungle Book'
item.description: The 10ft-long snake is rescued by firefighters in a village in rural Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Bourton-on-the-Water crowds enjoy river football match
item.description: Several hundred spectators watch the annual football in the river fixture in Bourton-on-the-Water.

item.title: Man wanted after bus driver spat at in Wembley
item.description: The incident happened after a passenger was asked to leave the bus for not wearing a mask.

item.title: Leamington Spa fire: Search on hold for man missing in blaze
item.description: It is still not safe for emergency crews to search for a missing worker at the site of a huge blaze.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Metâ€™s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Paramotor pilot shares pictures of John O'Groats-Land's End flight
item.description: Daniel Jones snaps aerial images from John O'Groats to Land's End while on a very personal mission.

item.title: Blackpool police shootings: 'Armed robber's bullet lodged near my heart'
item.description: Ian Hampson recalls one of Lancashire Police's darkest days, when he and two other officers were shot.

item.title: Toddler feared abducted to Spain flown home
item.description: The two-year-old girl had been taken on a flight from Glasgow to Spain by a man and a woman.

item.title: Decades of hoarding made house 'a no-go area'
item.description: A woman who struggled with buying and hoarding "bargains" for 30 years explains how it began.

item.title: Afghanistan events 'raw and emotional' for veterans
item.description: Military veteran Nick Wilson says the current Afghanistan crisis is affecting those who fought there.

item.title: Manchester Pride exhibition to reveal stories of freedom
item.description: The audio recordings and portraits form part of a weekend of cultural events to celebrate Pride.

item.title: Drone footage reveals scale of Leamington Spa fire
item.description: Flame and thick, dark smoke fills the sky above Leamington Spa.

item.title: Devon stroke victim inspired to get back on his feet
item.description: Chas Connal was inspired to walk again thanks to a bright idea from his stepdaughter.

item.title: Westminster double murder: Lee Peacock appears in court
item.description: Sharon Pickles and Clinton Ashmore were both fatally stabbed in central London in August.

item.title: A3 death: Man charged with Helen Anderson's murder
item.description: Helen Anderson's body was found in undergrowth beside a slip road on the A3 in Guildford.

item.title: Former Covid sceptic from Staffordshire Marcus Birks dies in hospital
item.description: Marcus Birks, 40, went on to urge other people to get the Covid vaccine after he was hospitalised.

item.title: Reading festival: Woman, 20, dies in hospital
item.description: Festival Republic said the 20-year-old had a pre-existing condition and died on Friday evening.

item.title: Fudstock festival: Three injured in Barrow fairground ride incident
item.description: One woman is in a critical condition in hospital and two others were seriously hurt.

item.title: Moped rider's rude name place tour finishes in Bell End
item.description: Paul Taylor made the charity fundraising trip in memory of a friend who died of cancer.

item.title: County Championship: Chris Benjamin and Sam Hain make tons as Warwickshire dominate Lancashire
item.description: Chris Benjamin makes his maiden century and Sam Hain also hits a ton as Warwickshire reach 259-3 against Lancashire.

item.title: Super League: Catalans 64-0 Leigh - Super League leaders thrash struggling Centurions
item.description: Mike McMeeken and Fouad Yaha both score a hat-trick of tries as Super League leaders Catalans ran riot against struggling Leigh.

item.title: Troy Deeney: Birmingham City sign striker after 11-year spell at Watford ends
item.description: Birmingham City sign striker Troy Deeney on a two-year deal after he left Watford earlier on Monday.

item.title: Super League: Warrington 14-24 St Helens - Saints come from behind to beat Wire
item.description: St Helens avenge their home defeat by Warrington in June as they come from behind to beat Wire at the Halliwell Jones Stadium.
